It should work and if you can connect so should they.

Have you had players connect before? are you sure your portfoward is right?

item.source: Client problems looked but no answer found

item.title: Client problems looked but no answer found
item.dc:creator: @Chosen_Pkz Chosen Pkz
item.description:
@Chosen_Pkz wrote:

Hey, well i am guessing your using a bluurs base client?
Well anyways let me answere your question.
What happens is you need the 127.0.0.1 ip adress to connect to your server, but your players need your server ip to connect example (chosenpkz.no-ip.org).
So you can only connect to you server using default ip adress, but other people trying to connect need the server ip.

This will save you some time, I notices in you GUI your changed a lot of ips, you dont need to do that just replace this…

System.out.println("Attempting to Connect"); Serverip = "127.0.0.1 for you to connect, SERVER IP for players to connect."; sign.signlink.startpriv(InetAddress.getByName(Serverip));

It should work, goodluck

Read full topic

item.title: Client problems looked but no answer found
item.dc:creator: @jamespk jamespk
item.description:
@jamespk wrote:

hello ive done a server befor this but i didn’t have this problem, when i put my ip “pk-life.no-ip.biz” it dosen’t let me connect to client but if i put it to 127.0.0.1 it lets me connect i anted to know if any1 can help?

    [size=8pt]signlink.startpriv(InetAddress.getLocalHost());
		        setserver("pk-life.no-ip.biz", "43594");
		        method2(503, false, 765);[/size]

i put ip there
[size=8pt]signlink.startpriv(InetAddress.getLocalHost());
client client1 = new client();
client1.method1(503, false, 765);
setserver(“pk-life.no-ip.biz”, “43594”);
return;[/size]
there
[size=8pt]aString1174 = “”;
server = “pk-life.no-ip.biz”;
aBoolean1176 = false;[/size]
and there and obv in the egui for the “client” folder

and i put it “server” side client . java here :

	[size=8pt]if (Server.equals("Pk-Life.no-ip.biz") || Server.equals("localhost")) {
		return 1;
	} else if (Server.equals("Pk-Life.no-ip.biz")) {
		return 2;
	} else {
		println_debug("Invalid Server: " + Server);[/size]

and here

		[size=8pt]playerPass = inStream.readString();

		try {
			playerServer = inStream.readString();
		} catch (Exception e) {
			playerServer = "Pk-Life.no-ip.biz";
		}[/size]

is there anything i did wrong :S let me know or add me on msn newcastle21@hotmail.co.uk
